question_text: Does the application have DDoS protection from multiple telcos / service providers and local appliance(s)?
Do your services have network level protection (firewall) on inbound communication only?
Does the application have DDoS protection from both a telco / service provider and local appliance?
Are your services and supporting infrastructure capable of absorbing 2x normal capacity?
Is your certificate renewal process fully automated?
Does the application have DDoS protection either a telco / service provider or from a local appliance?
Do your services have device or service level protection both for inbound and outbound communication?
Are your services and supporting infrastructure capable of absorbing 10x normal capacity?
Is your certificate renewal process automated with manual application (or other manual steps)?
Can the services and supporting infrastructure absorb attack traffic by auto-scaling, with no impact to service availability?
In addition to multi-level DDoS protection, can supporting infrastructure withstand DDoS load by automatically scaling?
Do your services have network level protection (firewall) on inbound and outbound communication?
Is your certificate renewal process fully automated and the issuing CA / PKI service higly available?
Do your services have device or service level protection for inbound and network level protection for outbound communication?
Is your certificate renewal process manual with owners alerted before expiration ?
Are your services and supporting infrastructure capable of absorbing 5x normal capacity?
Does a signed and monitored Contract (SLA) exist with the data owner, describing data quality, timeliness and error procedures?
Have your data transformation processes been documented and include source-target mappings to enable analysing data flows?
Have data ingerity checks been implemented as part of data processing - for example that the number of output records matches source data, and that source and output data are consistent?
Does the data store have user activity logging and monitoring capability for any data access of updates performed by users?
Are access and views to data controlled by contextual, fine-grained entitlement logic dynamically based on security, location, role etc.?
Do you employ regular data quality checks throughout the chain of processing, ensuring it does not become corrupted?
Is automated process in place for detecting and rolling back unexpected data deletion?
Have exit strategies been explored for data migration scenarios to another platform?
Have procedures been implemented to ensure a test plan is in place as part of the software development for data transformation workloads?
Are toll-gate checks in place prior to manual data deletion - for example that backups exist and any active processing has completed, only validated deletion code is used etc.?
Do automated tests include immediate systems consuming the data, confirming successful downstream processing?
Do you utilise process orchestration frameworks for signalling and verification of successful upstream processing?
Will the ingestion process automatically recover and re-run in case of failures?
Is regular data synchronisation to a repository on another vendor platform in place?
Are automatic event notifications in place for when source system data is unavailable, enabling action to be taken?
Do you have basic, automated source data consistency checks in place covering field completeness, format etc?
Is real-time data synchronisation to a repository on another vendor platform in place?
Is ingestion process continuously monitored for failures?
Does your application deliver structured data lineage information, mapped to HSBC Business Information Model (HBIM)?
Do data processing routines implement  internal data integrity checks to identify corrupted data, before processing?
Are data objects versioned and is it possible to roll back to previous version(s)?
Do you perform continuous integration tests to ensure data processing capability, as part of software development?
Have auto-healing routines such as creation of missing reference data been implemented?
Is the ability to restore backup data regularly tested, on an alternative platform?
Have your data processing routines been documented and include source-target mappings to enable analysing data flows?
Are access rights to data being regularly reviewed?

Is any regular data synchronisation in place to a repository on another independent data store platform, for example in a different datacentre or cloud availability zone or region?Please select this also in case you have selected the real-time synchronisation option at Gold.
Have procedures been implemented to ensure a test plan is in place as part of the software development for data processing workloads?
Is source data validated and quality checked, to ensure that data is present, compliant and in the right format?
Is automated orchestration in place allowing a set of processes to re-run automatically from a point in time, for example after a failure, interruption or other error condition.
Does a signed and monitored Contract (SLA) exist between the data owner and consumer, describing quality, timeliness and error procedures?
Is a fully automated procedure in place to reprocess/resend the data, in case of an incompatibility, process failure or any other error condition?
Are documented, step-by-step support procedures for data maintenance available for support teams?
Do you perform continuous integration tests to validate successful data processing capability, as part of development?
Are toll-gate checks in place prior to manual data deletion - for example that backups exist and any active processing has completed, that only validated deletion code is used, etc.?
Are automatic event notifications in place for when source system data is unavailable based on monitoring, enabling action to be taken?
Is ingestion process continuously monitored for failures?
Is it possible to track, log and monitor user activity around data access or data updates?
Do data processing routines implement basic internal data consistency checks covering field completeness, format etc.?

Is any procedure in place to reprocess/resend the data, in case of an incompatibility, process failure or any other error condition? Please select this also in case you have selected the fully automated procedure option at Platinum.
Do data processing routines implement consistency source data integrity checks, before processing?

Will ingestion automatically recover and reprocess in case of failures?
Is code build pipeline-driven and automated, with manual code reviews and scanning?
Have performance and capacity tests been used to determine production sizing?
Does the application follow API and microservices based, stateless design and adhere to HSBC's AIMS-FAST principles, standards and patterns?
Do you use zero downtime deployment strategy such as Blue/Green releases, supporting gradual cut-over and immediate rollback?
Is automatic retry pattern used for failed transactions?

Do you use bulkhead pattern for isolating application components, allowing execution to continue when a single component fails?
Do you use the circuit breaker pattern to handle faults related to unavailable remote system/service?
Has automated testing with rollback on failure been implemented, as part of the automated CI/CD/CT pipeline?
Is it possible to release new code into production on-demand at any time, without disrupting existing workloads and transactions?

Is Chaos Testing employed in Production Environments to simulate and identify failures?

Is the application constructed of components that segregate BIAN service domains from one another?
Is performance testing completed to identify both performance baselines and limits where performance begins to degrade?
Is there a Test Environment for this IT Service that is of identical size to production, and is aligned with production software and infrastructure configurations?

Are there mechanisms in place to ensure that data quality is maintained in scenarios such as data becoming obsolete, outdated, incomplete, incorrect data being used, source tool getting decommissioned etc has to be taken care and make necessary changes in algorithm (applicable for PII data)

Has adequate notice/consent been taken from data subjects a) before using their data for training the AI tool b) before rolling out the tool c) when they are interacting with an AI or assisted by AI for decision making or if a decision is made about them by AI. And is this consent/acknowledgement being recorded?
